page.title: 01Kilmartin Glen, Argyll
page.content: The area is principally moorland & rough hill, deciduous & conifer plantations, & some arable & pasture. The main occupation is raising sheep & cattle, & there is a gravel quarry. The hills harbour roe & red deer & there is no organised stalking or shooting. kilmartin village is ancient, & the long human occupation of the area is shown by at least eleven prehistoric sites (including hill forts, chambered tombs standing stones, & inscribed rock); by a ruined castle & carved monuments from the middle ages; & by hill settlements abandoned in the nineteenth century
